Articles.Content:
Presenting the Little Dipper! An incredibly fun and functional ion plane that can transport one Kerbal.

Features:

One ion engine for efficiency

Plenty of RCS for taking off, stunts, and speed boost

Parachute for emergency landings (pretty much any landing on Duna)

All of the small science, including the nose cone

Two probe cores for better SAS stability

Capable of operating in all atmospheric environments

Take one to your Duna/Eve/Laythe base today and have fun flying! Disclaimer: I haven't actually tested it on Laythe or Eve. Laythe might be too far away for the solar panels to keep the charge up, and it probably has really short range on Eve. But it works really well on Duna! It even can probably SSTO there. If only Duna had biomes...

How to fly:

Make sure that you are controlling from the forward-facing probe core or the Kerbal.

Throttle up and turn on RCS.

For short take-off, you can speed up more quickly by pressing H.

Nose up with RCS on, the plane should get into the air. Don't climb too quickly at first.

To land with parachute, fly low near the ground.

Turn RCS on, then pop the chute. Try to stay horizontal using RCS so you land on the landing gear.

The craft file included has a pod attached so you can get a Kerbal out and fly around KSC right away. The root part is the probe core on the docking port on the bottom, so if you want to use it as a sub-assembly, take the pod off and grab it by the docking port.

http://www./download/x5y8quexxboh8jh/Little+Dipper.craft
I'm very tempted to take this thing out towards duna! It looks good, and i guess it's easy to control aswell. I'm really fond of tiny airplanes, their fun factor is just so much higher!
